{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3311732,"name":"Red Thunder Robotics","username":"RedThunderRobotics","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/redthunderrobotics/{size}/218771_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-17T17:13:03.718Z","cooked":"

One of the levers on port 2 is loose and falling off. We are also having issues keeping our power cables in (same channel), so we’re hoping there is a way to replace it.

I don’t think it would be legal to repair it, you should try contacting rev support, they’ll probably send you a new one.

It’s explicitly legal to repair it:

FRC Rules Search

Rule R710

R710      *Only specified modifications to control system devices permitted. The Driver Station Software, roboRIO, PDP/PDH, PCM(s)/PH(s), VRM(s)/RPM(s), RSL, 120A breaker, motor controllers, MXP devices used to control...

REV support is still likely a better option in the long run.
